thread.title_full: Tourism Australia launches new website to lure young Japanese travellersTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Tourism Australia launches new website to lure young Japanese travellersTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Tourism Australia launches new website to lure young Japanese travellers Published  
Tourism Australia launched a new website on Oct 13 hoping to tempt young Japanese travellers for an extended stay. The website promotes the working holiday visa to strengthen its appeal to Japanese travellers.The site features testimonial videos and a competition to win a four week English course with homestay and return flights to encourage applications.
Tourism Australia has also partnered with one of Japan’s biggest broadcasters, TBS, to showcase a variety of working holiday experiences with a Japanese pop-idol group KAT-TUN.TBS’ weekly show “KAT-TUN no Sekaiichi Tameninaru Tabi” (The World
Best Trip) will also run a Gold Coast special feature following a recent trip supported by Tourism Australia and Tourism & Events Queensland.
Currently 20,000 Japanese take up working holiday visas annually and Australia has consistently ranked the number one destination and taken over 50 per cent of this market.
Japan was Australia’s seventh largest inbound market for visitor arrivals (321,000). For the 12 months to August 2015.Key reasons cited by Japanese working holiday makers for choosing Australia are: global culture; friendly people; liveable cities; good wages; maximum two year working holiday visa and no time difference.
 
Source:-Tourism Australia
